metadata.Title: CVE-2015-5788 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The WebKit Canvas implementation in Apple iOS before 9 allows remote attackers to bypass the Same Origin Policy and obtain sensitive image information via vectors involving a CANVAS element.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-5788` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-1.0 - 2.4.10-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-3.0 - 2.4.10-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
gir1.2-webkit-1.0 - 2.4.10-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
gir1.2-webkit-3.0 - 2.4.10-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
gir1.2-webkit2-3.0 - 2.4.10-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
libjavascriptcoregtk-1.0-0 - 2.4.10-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
libjavascriptcoregtk-3.0-0 - 2.4.10-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
libjavascriptcoregtk-3.0-bin - 2.4.10-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
libwebkit2gtk-3.0-25 - 2.4.10-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
libwebkitgtk-1.0-0 - 2.4.10-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
libwebkitgtk-1.0-common - 2.4.10-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
libwebkitgtk-3.0-0 - 2.4.10-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
libwebkitgtk-3.0-common - 2.4.10-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: jdstrand> webkit receives limited support. For details, see https://wiki.ubuntu.com/SecurityTeam/FAQ#webkit webkit in Ubuntu uses the JavaScriptCore (JSC) engine, not V8

criterions.comment: qtwebkit-opensource-src: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
qtwebkit-source: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
webkitgtk package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.4.10-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
